meanings.definition: To make a series of slight, sharp noises
meanings.sent1: The branches were crankling in the wind.
meanings.sent2: I heard the leaves crankling under my feet as I walked through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The old radio started crankling out a tune from the past.
meanings.sent4: The popcorn in the microwave was crankling like a tiny firework show.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the campfire crankling was soothing on the cool night.

meanings.definition: To cause to make a series of slight, sharp noises
meanings.sent1: She accidentally stepped on a twig, crankling it loudly.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic was crankling the rusty gears back into motion.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat enjoyed crankling the paper bags in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent4: His laughter crankled through the silent room, breaking the tension.
meanings.sent5: The wind crankled the chimes, creating a melodious sound in the garden.

meanings.definition: A series of slight, sharp noises
meanings.sent1: The crankling of the keys jingled in his pocket.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious crankling in the attic kept them awake at night.
meanings.sent3: The crankling of the ice cubes in the glass signaled the start of the party.
meanings.sent4: The distant crankling of the train added to the peaceful atmosphere of the countryside.
meanings.sent5: The crankling of the typewriter filled the room with a rhythmic sound.
